Text:
So, Heiress...what were you doing in the garden this
late at night?

I don't care if this is technically your gardenâ€”this
is no time for a girl to be out wandering alone.

Zeta softens her tone, not wanting to put any
pressure on the heiress.

But that doesn't change the fact that Zeta is still a
powerful intruder. The dark knight's hands tremble
slightly at the sight of her.
I came out here...to do some thinking.
Thinking, eh?
(Could it be...the Cult already approached her?)

(That would validate my theory that the Cult is
trying to milk this town's elite for funding.)

Zeta's eyes narrow. Wanting more information from the
girl, she askes another question.

You must've had something quite complicated to think
about, eh?

You could have done your thinking in bed like a normal
person would do this late at night, yet you came out to
the garden with a sword instead.

I thought that moving around would clear my head. My
mind was so preoccupied that I couldn't sleep anyway.
Ohh. So what were you preoccupied with?
Just...my future.
Can you elaborate?
I have to get married.
Well, that's something... I'm happy for you?

There's nothing to be happy about. It's a strategic
marriageâ€”the only things I know about him are
what's written in his family chart.
A strategic marriage...
(Is her prospective groom connected to the Cult?)

(Like, they're taking over the whole family so the
goose will keep laying them golden eggs for years
to come?)

Now Zeta is fully invested in the girl's storyâ€”not
just as a nosy gossip, but as a spy.
So what's the lucky guy like?
He lives in the nearby village.
The nearby village...nearby village...
Zeta accesses the area's map in her mind.

A small town and a big village sandwich the ruins.
Each has about the same size population.

I think there's a pretty big village nearby. So the
guy you're marrying is from there, then.

Yes... I'm an only child, so he's marrying into our
family.

(If there's a difference in size, I imagine there's a
political power struggle between the two.)

He's one year older than me, and enjoys reading for
leisure... Hilarious, right?
I don't see what's so hilarious. Do you hate reading?

I have nothing to say about other people's hobbies.
If you like reading, then read to your heart's content.

But if that other person happens to be my prospective
husband, that changes everything.

I don't want to marry a man who is weaker than I am.
I want to marry someone who's strong.
Is that...an anti-marriage declaration?

Even though we've never actually fought, I can tell
that you're pretty good with a sword, Heiress.

I doubt you'll find anyone stronger than you in any
of the towns of villages near here... Ah hah. So
that's why you're not on board with marriage.

Answering her own question, Zeta finally understands
the girl.

How could I possibly be "on board" with marriage?
I saw his papers, and he had a very meek and feeble-
looking face.

I come from a long line of dark knights. We have a
historic collection of swords, armor, and weapons.
A bookworm could never appreciate its value.
(So Daddy's a collector of historic weaponry, eh?)

(In other words, be it swords or other weapons, this
mansion is chock-full of valuables.)

What could my father possibly be thinking? Taking in
a weak son-in-law like that!

Shh! Calm downâ€”no need to get angry. If you shout
like that, someone'll come out here.

And besides, how do you know he's weak just from
seeing his family papers?
Artists take liberties with portraits, too, y'know.
What do you mean...

Well, I don't know what your type is, but lots of
girls actually like pretty, elfish boys.

Maybe he only looked meek because he was drawn that
way...because they thought that would make him more
appealing.
You may be right, but...ah!

Though Zeta has no proof, her story is plausible.
The dark knight heiress gasps audibly, like she's
just had an idea.
I've just got a good idea!

You... Would you mind investigating my prospective
groom so I can see what kind of man he really is?
Huh?

For example...if he's sickly or if there's another
girl in his lifeâ€”if you could find any information
for me, I'd appreciate it.

(What's this? Is she trying to get me to help her
break off the engagement?)

(This coming from the girl who was scared of me just
a minute ago, knowing I was an intruder...)
(Heh! What an amusing little heiress...)
Zeta smirks and shrugs her shoulders.

If all you need is for me to spy on him a little,
I'm game. Sounds like a pretty easy job.
Though I'm definitely taking a big reward.

Of course. If you accept my request, I will pay you
handsomely.

Though Zeta is somewhat joking, the heiress's eyes
are dead serious.
Seeing this, Zeta wipes the grin off her face.

Okay, for my payment, can I see your father's
collection? If there's anything I take a liking to,
it's mine.
Very well... Look to your heart's content.

Okay, it's a deal! And I know it's an oral agreement,
but I'll come for you if you break your word.
Do you get my drift?

Y-Yes, I understand your terms...I don't suppose I
need to tell you who my prospective groom is?

As Zeta's smile deepens, the dark knight's face grows
tense with the realization of what she's just done.

As far as Zeta is concerned, investigating one young
man from the village is an extremely simple task.
(This is a low-risk, high-return gig.)

I've got this in the bag. I'll figure everything out
on my end. I'm just gonna go have a little look
at your groom. See you later.

Zeta says this casually. And with a little twirl,
she vanishes...
